value.title: Jellyfish Robots Could One Day Clean Up The World’s Oceans
value.excerpt: Marine plastic pollution is a bigger problem than some may realize. According to the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN), at least 14 million tons of plastic end up in the ocean every year, with plastic making up 80 percent of all the marine debris found across the water's surface and deep below.
